intro: Psychotria crassicalyx, commonly known as the red-eyed poison vine, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red flowers with yellow centers. The plant produces small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle it with care.
